definition: to put/to place/to release/to free/to let go/to let out/to set off (fireworks)

sentences.english: Locals also lit Kongming lanterns, and sent them into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 當地人還點亮孔明燈，把它們放飛到天空中。

sentences.english: Fly with the Youth Olympics dreams, step into the Jinling feast.
sentences.chinese: 放飛青奧夢想，走進金陵盛宴。

sentences.english: I want to wait a good long after the little sparrow wings, they fly it.
sentences.chinese: 我想等小麻雀翅膀長好後，就放飛它。

sentences.english: Let your imaginations roam free. The caveat: Don't touch, just talk.
Free soul readjust oneself to a certain extent flying , dodge broad-mindedly to be tolerant of return.
sentences.chinese: 把自由的心靈放飛，讓豁達寬容迴歸。

sentences.english: Put to fly the white pigeon, the song and dance peace and prosperity, pursue peaceful that kind of atmosphere.
sentences.chinese: 放飛白鴿，歌舞昇平，追求和平的那種氣氛。

sentences.english: The question we turned to was, just let your imagination run free.
sentences.chinese: 我們轉向的問題是，放飛你們的想象力。

sentences.english: Release of your self-imposed shackles and be free .
sentences.chinese: 放鬆自我施加的束縛，放飛自己。

sentences.english: He tried to fly his kite.
Another one lets you release butterflies with an app.
sentences.chinese: 另一個可讓人通過應用程序放飛蝴蝶。

sentences.english: Create art. Let your ideas flow.
sentences.chinese: 創意的藝術，放飛你的想法。

sentences.english: Then they lit a fire to fly the lantern.
sentences.chinese: 然後他們就點燃放飛燈籠。

sentences.english: Tourists launch a Chinese lantern into the sky.
sentences.chinese: 遊客放飛了一隻孔明燈。

sentences.english: A member of the Thai "Red Shirt" movement released a pigeon during a protest Friday in Bangkok.
sentences.chinese: 一名泰國紅杉軍成員在抗丆議活動中放飛一隻鴿子。

definition: to circle in the air/to soar
to illuminate/to turn on the lights/to light (a blaze)
to fulfill one's dream/(divination) to predict the future by interpreting a dream/oneiromancy
